page.title: 02THE A13 AND M25 IN THURROCK
page.content: There are two main roads passing through the area - the A13 from east to west and the M25 from north to south.Part of the A13 is a new dual carriageway opened in 1984, providing a good road link from the M25 to the refineries further east.(The old A13 has been redesignated the A1306). The M25 is known as the London Orbital Motorway and provides links from here to the M11 and M1 going north,to the M4 going west and the M2 and M20 going east to the Channel Ports.This stretch was opened in 1984 and leads south to the A282 Dartford Tunnel approach road which leads under the River Thames.
